summary: PRRS is characterized by reproductive disorders in pregnant sows and respiratory diseases in growing pigs. it is a viral disease caused by PRRS virus (PRRSV) (1,2) since its first outbreak in 1987 in USA (3), PRRS has spread to the major pig-producing countries and regions (4). PRRSV-encoded nsp 1, nsp 2, and nsp 11 and N protein play key roles in antagonizing the activation of IFN- promoter (21) these focused mainly on the stage of IFN- mRNA transcription, primarily in PRRSV permissive MARC-145 cells or non-permissive human cell culture systems. cellular miRNAs could be modulated during PRRSV infection (26–28) some miRNAs could promote or inhibit PRRSV replication (29–32) no literature on how PRRSV-modulating cellular miRNAs manipulate the protein expression of type I IFN has been documented. inactivated PRRSV cannot suppress type I IFN production induced by TGEV infection or poly I:C stimulation in PAMs. pathogenicity between HP-PRRSV and low pathogenic PRRSV strains is significantly different in vivo and in vitro. predicted miRNA-targeted binding sequences in porcine IFN- 3′UTR. sequences were from GenBank (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/GenBank), by miRanda (40), RNA hybrid (41) and PITA (42). miRNA mimics and miRNA inhibitors Based on the sequences of porcine cellular miRNAs. PCR was performed to generate porcine IFN- 3′UTR. pmirGLO-IFN- 3′UTR gene fragments and pmirGLO dual firefly/Renilla luciferase miRNA target expression vector were ligated together by T4 DNA ligase. plasmids were cloned into the pmirGLO dual firefly/Renilla luciferase miRNA target expression vector previously digested with PmeI and XbaI. all plasmids were verified by digesting with NotI and sequencing. TTTGACCATGTTGTGACGGGT miR-34a Mut-R CTAGACCCGTCACCCAACATGGCCGCTAGTTT miR-145 MRE-F. primer pairs were annealed and inserted into pmirGLO dual-luciferase miRNA target expression vector digested with PmeI and XbaI b NotI restriction endonuclease site is underlined. primary PAMs with a density of about 0.5–1105 cells per ml were seeded in 24-well culture plates, cultured at 37°C in a humidified incubator with 5% CO2 overnight. after changing to fresh medium, the cells were transfected transiently with miRNA mimics and inhibitors by HiPerFect® transfection reagent. dual luciferase reporter assay was performed using dual-luciferase® reporter assay system (Promega Corp.) the cells were co-transfected transiently with miRNA mimics and plasmid DNA (pmirGLO-IFN- 3′UTR orpmirGLO-MRE-wt orpmirGLO-MRE-mut) for 24 h. purified total RNAs and 0.5 g random primer hexa-deoxyribonucleotide mixture were mixed together and then placed in water bath at 70°C for 5 min. the mixture was incubated in water bath at 37°C for 1 h, and then cDNA template was obtained. the reaction was in a 20 l volume containing 10 l 2 SYBR® Green real-time PCR master mix. ative expression level of IFN- gene was analyzed using the Ct method. housekeeping gene RPL4 mRNA was used as an internal control. 1 g of purified total cellular RNAs was used for polyadenylation. primers for porcine let-7b, miR-26a, miR-34a, miR-145 and internal reference U6 were designed and synthesized. quantitative real-time PCR were performed with the primers for miRNAs using 7500 Real Time PCR system. the cell culture supernatant samples were harvested at different time points and used for detection of porcine IFN- protein by ELISA. the data are shown as relative expression levels of IFN- protein normalized to control group. a P0.05 was considered to indicate a statistically significant difference. miRNA mimics and miRNA inhibitors were synthesized with 2′-O-methyl modification by Shanghai GenePharma Co., Ltd. (Shanghai, China) pmirGLO-IFN- 3′UTR, pmirGLO-miRNA recognition elements (MRE)-wild type (wt) and pmirGLO-MRE-mutant type (mut) were constructed. PCR was performed to generate porcine IFN- 3′UTR. pmirGLO-IFN- 3′UTR gene fragments and pmirGLO dual firefly/Renilla luciferase miRNA target expression vector. plasmids were cloned into the pmirGLO dual firefly/Renilla luciferase miRNA target expression vector previously digested with PmeI and XbaI. all plasmids were verified by digesting with NotI and sequencing. primer pairs were annealed and inserted into pmirGLO dual-luciferase miRNA target expression vector digested with PmeI and XbaI b NotI restriction endonuclease site. 3D4/21 cells were seeded in 24-well cell culture plates and incubated overnight until the cell density reached 70–80%, then transfected by FuGENE® HD transfection reagent. primary PAMs with a density of about 0.5–1105 cells per ml were seeded in 24-well culture plates, cultured at 37°C in a humidified incubator with 5% CO2 overnight. after changing to fresh medium, the cells were transfected transiently with miRNA mimics and inhibitors by HiPerFect® transfection reagent. dual luciferase reporter assay was performed using a dual-luciferase reporter assay system (Promega Corp.) the cells were co-transfected transiently with miRNA mimics and plasmid DNA (pmirGLO-IFN- 3′UTR orpmirGLO-MRE-wt or pmirGLO-MRE-mut) for 24 h. mRNA, 1 g purified total RNAs and 0.5 g random primer hexa-deoxyribonucleotide mixture (Takara Biotechnology Co., Ltd.) were mixed together, and then placed in water bath at 70°C for 5 min. immediately cooled on ice for 5 min, the product was added to the following reaction components for reverse transcription. IFN- gene was analyzed using the Ct method. housekeeping gene RPL4 mRNA was used as an internal control. 1 g of purified total cellular RNAs was used for polyadenylation. primers for porcine let-7b, miR-26a, miR-34a, miR-145 and internal reference U6 were designed and synthesized. quantitative real-time PCR were performed with the primers for miRNAs using 7500 Real Time PCR system. porcine IFN- detection was performed using a commercial ELISA kit. mock-infected or negative control-transfected or mock-treated cells acted as control group, respectively. the cells were grown in RPMI-1640 medium (thermo Fisher Scientific, Inc., Waltham, MA, USA) at 37°C, with 5% CO2. miRNA mimics and miRNA inhibitors were synthesized with 2′-O-methyl modification by Shanghai GenePharma Co., Ltd. PCR was performed to generate porcine IFN- 3′UTR. pmirGLO-IFN- 3′UTR gene fragments and pmirGLO dual firefly/Renilla luciferase miRNA target expression vector were ligated together. plasmids were cloned into the pmirGLO dual firefly/Renilla luciferase miRNA target expression vector previously digested with PmeI and XbaI. all plasmids were verified by digesting with NotI and sequencing. miR-34a Mut-F AAACTAGCGGCCGCTAGTTTGACCATGTTGACGGGT miR-145 Mut-R CTAGACCACCCAACATGGTCAAACTAGCGCTAGTTT miR-145 MRE-F AAACTAGCGCTAGTCTCTCTCTCTCTCTCTCTCTCTCTCTCTCTCTCTCTCTCTCTCTCTCTCTCTCTCTCTCTCTCTCTCTCTCTCTCT miR-145 Mut-R CTAGAGAG primary PAMs with a density of about 0.5–1105 cells per ml were seeded in 24-well culture plates, cultured at 37°C in a humidified incubator with 5% CO2 overnight. after changing to fresh medium, the cells were transfected transiently with miRNA mimics and inhibitors by HiPerFect® transfection reagent. dual luciferase reporter assay was performed using a dual-luciferase reporter assay system (Promega Corp.) the cells were co-transfected transiently with miRNA mimics and plasmid DNA (pmirGLO-IFN- 3′UTR orpmirGLO-MRE-wt or pmirGLO-MRE-mut) for 24 h. total RNAs were digested by TRIzol reagent ( 1 g purified total RNAs and 0.5 g random primer hexa-deoxyribonucleotide mixture (Takara Biotechnology Co., Ltd.) were mixed together and then placed in water bath at 70°C for 5 min. immediately cooled on ice for 5 min, the product was added to the following reaction components for reverse transcription. IFN- gene was analyzed using the Ct method and the housekeeping gene RPL4 mRNA was used as an internal control. 1 g of the purified total cellular RNAs was used for polyadenylation. primers for porcine let-7b, miR-26a, miR-34a, miR-145 and internal reference U6 were designed and synthesized. quantitative real-time PCR were performed with the primers for miRNAs using 7500 real time PCR system. ml poly I:C (Sigma-Aldrich, Inc., St. Louis, MO, USA) mock-infected or negative control-transfected or mock-treated cells acted as control group. the results showed that IFN- mRNA transcription levels increased from 12 to 36 hpi compared with mock group. mRNA levels of porcine IFN- in PRRSV-infected PAMs and protein expression levels in culture supernatants of PRRSV-infected PAMs were detected by real-time PCR and ELISA. primary PAMs were infected with JXwn06 or HB-1/3.9 at MOI of 0.01 or 1. mRNA transcription levels in porcine IFN- mRNA were significantly different at 36 hpi between JXwn06- and HB-1/3.9-infected PAMs. transcription levels of porcine IFN- mRNA were significantly different at 36 hpi between the two strains of PRRSV. levels of PRRSV-infected PAMs, the IFN- protein data were shown as relative expression levels normalized to negative control group at each time point. the relative protein expression levels of porcine IFN- at MOI of 1 were lower than that at MOI of 0.01 in both JXwn06- and HB-1/3.9-infected PAMs. the inhibition effect of porcine IFN- protein expression by HP-PRRSV was stronger. cellular miRNAs let-7b, miR-26a, miR-34a and miR-145 could target porcine IFN- 3′UTR. the binding sequences were located at 160–181, 9–31, 27–47 and 12–32 bp in porcine IFN- 3′UTR. 3D4/21 cells were co-transfected with pmirGLO-MRE-wtor pmirGLO-MRE-mut and miRNA mimics at 60 nM, dual luciferase activity reporter assay. the results represent means standard error of the mean of three independent experiments. miRNA mimics inhibited the expression of firefly luciferase of pmirGLO-MRE-wt. the inhibition of firefly luciferase expression by miRNA was weakened. let-7b, miR-26a, miR-34a and miR-145 were capable of interacting with the predicted miRNA binding sequence in porcine IFN- 3′UTR. three of the four miRNA inhibitors were able to weaken the suppression effect of porcine cellular endogenous miRNAs in primary PAMs. compared with the negative control group, except for the miR-145, three of the four miRNA inhibitors were able to weaken the suppression effect of porcine cellular endogenous miRNAs. the native IFN- protein induction stimulated by poly I:C could upregulate the expression of endogenous miRNAs in primary PAMs. the results were normalized to U6 expression and mock-treated controls. let-7b, miR-26a, miR-34a and miR-145 were upregulated significantly in early stages of IFN- protein expression. the four cellular miRNAs could modulate the protein induction of IFN- in PAMs. the native IFN- induced in PAMs could also regulate the expression of four endogenous miRNAs. the HP-PRRSV JXwn06 exhibits a higher ability of inducing let-7b, miR-26a, miR-34a and miR-145 levels than low pathogenic PRRSV HB-1/3.9 during early infection. qRT-PCR analysis of cellular endogenous miRNAs including let-7b, miR-26a, miR-34a and miR-145 in primary PAMs infected with JXwn06 or HB- the protein expression of IFN- was upregulated in the miRNA inhibitor-transfected primary PAMs during PRRSV infection at 24 hpi. compared with PRRSV-infected PAMs transfected with all miRNA inhibitors, but miRNA-145 inhibitor, the protein expression of IFN- in HB-1/3.9-infected PAMs was higher than that in JXwn06-infected PAMs. IFN- mRNA transcription levels increased from 12 to 36 hpi in primary PAMs early infected with PRRSV. mRNA levels of porcine IFN- in PRRSV-infected PAMs were detected by real-time PCR and ELISA. ine IFN- at MOI of 1 were higher than that at MOI of 0.01 in both JXwn06- and HB-1/3.9-infected PAMs. the regulation effect of PRRSV on porcine IFN- mRNA transcription is dose-dependent in primary PAMs infected with PRRSV. relative concentration of IFN- protein normalized to negative control decreased. relative expression levels of porcine IFN- at MOI of 1 were lower than that at MOI of 0.01 in both JXwn06- and HB-1/3.9-infected PAMs. cellular miRNAs let-7b, miR-26a, miR-34a and miR-145 could target porcine IFN- 3′UTR. the binding sequences were located at 160–181, 9–31, 27–47 and 12–32 bp in porcine IFN- 3′UTR. 3D4/21 cells were co-transfected with miRNA mimics at a final concentration of 10 or 40 nM. miRNA mimics could inhibit the expression of firefly luciferase in pmirGLO-IFN- 3′UTR. the 3D4/21 cells were co-transfected with pmirGLO-MRE-wt or pmirGLO-MRE-mut. miRNA mimics inhibited the expression of firefly luciferase of pmirGLO-MRE-wt. inhibition of firefly luciferase expression by miRNA was weakened for pmirGLO-MRE-mut. miRNA mimics including let-7b, miR-26a, miR-34a and miR-145 were capable of inhibiting the protein production of porcine IFN- in primary PAMs at 10 nM. at 40 nM the inhibition effect of four miRNAs were significantly stronger. compared with the negative control group, three of the four miRNA inhibitors weakened the suppression effect of porcine cellular endogenous miRNAs in primary PAMs. the native IFN- protein induction stimulated by poly I:C could upregulate the expression of endogenous miRNAs in primary PAMs. the results were normalized to U6 expression and mock-treated controls. FN- protein could lead to upregulation of endogenous miRNA levels. miR-26a and miR-34a were upregulated significantly in early stages of IFN- protein expression at a low level. native IFN- induced in PAMs could also regulate expression of four endogenous miRNAs. let-7b, miR-26a, miR-34a and miR-145 in HB-1/3.9-infected PAMs were significantly higher than those in HB-1/3.9-infected PAMs at 24 hpi. qRT-PCR analysis of cellular endogenous miRNAs including let-7b, miR-26a, miR-34a and miR-145 in primary PAMs infected with JXwn06 or HB- primary PAMs were transfected with miRNA inhibitors including the antagonists of let-7b, miR-26a, miR-34a and miR-145. the protein expression of IFN- was upregulated in the miRNA inhibitor-transfected primary PAMs during PRRSV infection at 24 hpi. the protein expression of IFN- was upregulated in the miRNA inhibitor-transfected primary PAMs during PRRSV infection at 24 hpi. supernatant samples were subjected to detection of the protein concentration of IFN-. compared with mock group, IFN- mRNA transcription levels increased from 12 to 36 hpi both in JXwn06- and HB-1/3.9-infected PAMs. transcription levels of porcine IFN- mRNA at MOI of 1 were higher than that at MOI of 0.01 in both JXwn06- and HB-1/3.9-infected PAMs. the regulation effect of PRRSV on porcine IFN- mRNA transcription is dose-dependent in primary PAMs infected with PRRSV. control PAM cells increased higher than that in the culture supernatants of PRRSV-infected PAM cells at each time point. relative concentration of IFN- protein normalized to negative control decreased. mRNA transcription levels of IFN- in primary PAMs were upregulated, whereas its protein relative expression levels were downregulated. cellular miRNAs let-7b, miR-26a, miR-34a and miR-145 could target porcine IFN- 3′UTR. the binding sequences were located at 160–181, 9–31, 27–47 and 12–32 bp in porcine IFN- 3′UTR. pmirGLO-IFN- 3′UTR gene was cloned into the downstream of firefly luciferase in pmirGLO dual firefly/Renilla luciferase miRNA target expression vector. miRNA mimics could inhibit the expression of firefly luciferase in pmirGLO-IFN- 3′UTR. miRNA mimics inhibited the expression of firefly luciferase of pmirGLO-MRE-wt. at 40 nM the inhibition of four miRNAs was stronger. miRNA mimics inhibited the expression of firefly luciferase of pmirGLO-MRE-mut. a final concentration of 50 g/ml poly I:C was used to stimulate the PAMs for 24 h. miRNA mimics including let-7b, miR-26a, miR-34a and miR-145 were capable of inhibiting the protein production of porcine IFN- in primary PAMs at 10 nM. at 40 nM the relieving effect of four miRNA inhibitors were significantly stronger. the native IFN- protein induction stimulated by poly I:C could upregulate the expression of endogenous miRNAs in primary PAMs. the results were normalized to U6 expression and mock-treated controls. cellular endogenous miRNAs were increased only at or after the first augmentation of native IFN- protein induction in primary PAMs. the miR-26a and miR-34a had a significant increase, and let-7b was initially increased, and then decreased. the miR-145 showed an increase at a low level, demonstrating that it was exquisite for native IFN- protein to modulate the expression of cellular endogenous miRNAs. PRRSV infection is capable of inducing the generation of cellular let-7b, miR-26a, miR-34a and miR-145 during the early infection. the levels of let-7b, miR-26a, miR-34a and miR-145 in JXwn06-infected PAMs were significantly higher than those in HB-1/3.9-infected PAMs at 24 hpi. the data represent means standard error of the mean of three independent experiments (*P0.05; **P0.01) the roles of miRNAs in PRRSV-mediated inhibition of porcine IFN- protein expression were further analyzed. primary PAMs were transfected transiently with miRNA inhibitors including the antagonists of let-7b, miR-26a, miR-34a and miR-145. cellular miRNA-mediated regulation of IFN- protein expression was investigated in primary PAMs infected with PRRSV in vitro. previous studies have demonstrated that PRRSV is a poor inducer of type I IFN in vitro and in vivo (1,50) HP-PRRSV JXwn06 and low pathogenic PRRSV HB-1/3.9 induced differential levels of IFN- protein expression in PAMs in vitro during early infection. the differential IFN- response of PAMs to different pathogenic PRRSV strains may be due to the viral distinct characteristics. compared with wild-type viruses, UV- and heat-inactivated PRRSV fail to suppress type I IFN production in vitro. previous studies showed that type I IFN induction correlated with the virulence of some viruses. a similar phenomenon has been described by an early study using primary primate macrophages (47) it is possible that porcine IFN- response is modulated at different levels in primary PAMs. further studies are required to discover additional mechanisms or miRNAs in primary PAMs. PRRSV infection can suppress host miR-125b and poly I:C-induced miR-23. many viruses could induce miRNAs to escape from immune responses. this could be strategies for PRRSV to evade type I IFN response.
